NOTE_ID: note_074

INDICATION FOR OPERATION [REDACTED] is a 63-year-old male who presents with recurrent granulation tissue.
The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.
CONSENT Obtained before the procedure. Indications, potential complications, and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate.
Consent was signed and witnessed by an assisting medical professional.
PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

PROCEDURE

31645 Therapeutic aspiration initial episode 

31624 Dx bronchoscope/lavage (BAL) 

31636 Dilate and bronchial stent initial bronchus 

31641 Destruction of tumor OR relief of stenosis by any method other than excision (eg. laser therapy, cryotherapy) 

Rigid Bronchoscopy 

ATTENDING Dr. Ingraham

ASSISTANT Dr. Lee

SUPPORT STAFF RN: [Name] RT: [Name]

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.
INSTRUMENTATION Rigid Bronchoscope; Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).
Patient Position: [Supine] 

Initial Airway Inspection Findings: Rigid Black ventilating scope was used to intubate the patient.
Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem from mucus.
Endobronchial Tumor Destruction Endobronchial obstruction at the Right Mainstem (90% obstruction) was treated with the following modalities:


Electrocautery: Snare for 10 seconds; removed.


Mechanical Debridement for 2 min and 1.5 min; ablated.
Prior to treatment, affected airway was noted to be 0% patent. After treatment, the airway was 100% patent.
Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the RLL basal subsegment subsegments from mucus.
Airway Stent Placement The following stent (Ultraflex 12x20) was placed in the RLL basal subsegment to the RC1.
The stent was placed jailing RML (origin of the tumor).
Bronchoalveolar Lavage (BAL) Bronchial alveolar lavage was performed at the Superior Segment of Lingula (LB4) and Inferior Segment of Lingula (LB5).
Instilled 30 cc of NS, suction returned with 15 cc of NS. Samples sent for Microbiology (Cultures/Viral/Fungal).
The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.
SPECIMENS

Tumor from RM 

BAL 

IMPRESSION / PLAN

Follow-up in clinic.

Follow-up in 4-6 weeks post-procedure for stent check.

Start stent hydration protocol.

INDICATION FOR OPERATION [REDACTED] is a 63-year-old male who presents with extrinsic compression with endobronchial invasion.
The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.
CONSENT Obtained before the procedure. Indications, potential complications, and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate.
Consent was signed and witnessed by an assisting medical professional.
PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

PROCEDURE

31645 Therapeutic aspiration initial episode 

31624 Dx bronchoscope/lavage (BAL) 

31636 Dilate and bronchial stent initial bronchus 

31641 Destruction of tumor OR relief of stenosis by any method other than excision (eg. laser therapy, cryotherapy) 

Rigid Bronchoscopy 

ATTENDING Dr. Al-Fayed

ASSISTANT Dr. Stevens

SUPPORT STAFF RN: [Name] RT: [Name]

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.
INSTRUMENTATION Rigid Bronchoscope; Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).
Patient Position: [Supine] 

Initial Airway Inspection Findings: Rigid Black ventilating scope was used to intubate the patient.
Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem from mucus.
Endobronchial Tumor Destruction Endobronchial obstruction at the Right Mainstem (100% obstruction) was treated with the following modalities:


Electrocautery: Knife (PreciSect) for 10 seconds; removed.


Cryotherapy: Probe for 2 min and 1.5 min; ablated.
Prior to treatment, affected airway was noted to be 0% patent. After treatment, the airway was 100% patent.
Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the LLL basal subsegment subsegments from mucus.
Airway Stent Placement The following stent (Bonastent 12x40) was placed in the LLL basal subsegment to the LC2.
The stent was placed jailing RML (origin of the tumor).
Bronchoalveolar Lavage (BAL) Bronchial alveolar lavage was performed at the Left Lower Lobe (LLL).
Instilled 50 cc of NS, suction returned with 20 cc of NS. Samples sent for Microbiology (Cultures/Viral/Fungal).
The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.
SPECIMENS

Tumor from RM 

BAL 

IMPRESSION / PLAN

[REDACTED] is a 63-year-old male who presents for bronchoscopy for endobronchial obstruction.
Follow-up in clinic.

Follow-up in 4-6 weeks post-procedure for stent check.

Start stent hydration protocol.

prompt: 37 M, carcinoid tumor obstruction. Left Lower Lobe completely blocked. Debulked w/ laser ablation + cryoprobe. Ultraflex stent placed. BAL done. Pt stable.

Patient Position: [Supine] 

Initial Airway Inspection Findings: Rigid Black ventilating scope was used to intubate the patient.
Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem from mucus.
Endobronchial Tumor Destruction Endobronchial obstruction at the Left Mainstem (95% obstruction) was treated with the following modalities:


APC (Argon Plasma Coagulation) for 10 seconds; removed.


Microwave: Mini probe (90°C) for 2 min and 1.5 min; ablated.
Prior to treatment, affected airway was noted to be 0% patent. After treatment, the airway was 100% patent.
Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the LMS mid-distal subsegments from mucus.

Instilled 30 cc of NS, suction returned with 15 cc of NS. Samples sent for Microbiology (Cultures/Viral/Fungal).
The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

ATTENDING Dr. Jones

ASSISTANT Dr. Gupta

SUPPORT STAFF RN: [Name] RT: [Name]

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.
INSTRUMENTATION Rigid Bronchoscope; Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).
Patient Position: [Supine] 

Initial Airway Inspection Findings: Rigid Black ventilating scope was used to intubate the patient.
Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem from mucus.
Endobronchial Tumor Destruction Endobronchial obstruction at the Bronchus Intermedius (99% obstruction) was treated with the following modalities:


Electrocautery: Snare for 10 seconds; removed.


Cryotherapy: Probe for 2 min and 1.5 min; ablated.
Prior to treatment, affected airway was noted to be 0% patent. After treatment, the airway was 100% patent.
Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the RLL basal subsegment subsegments from mucus.
Airway Stent Placement The following stent (Silicone Y-Stent 14x12x12) was placed in the RLL basal subsegment to the RC1.
The stent was placed jailing RML (origin of the tumor).
Bronchoalveolar Lavage (BAL) Bronchial alveolar lavage was performed at the Right Middle Lobe (RML).
Instilled 20 cc of NS, suction returned with 10 cc of NS. Samples sent for Microbiology (Cultures/Viral/Fungal).
The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

APC (Argon Plasma Coagulation) for 10 seconds; removed.


Microwave: Mini probe (90°C) for 2 min and 1.5 min; ablated.

Instilled 20 cc of NS, suction returned with 10 cc of NS. Samples sent for Microbiology (Cultures/Viral/Fungal).
The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.
